metadata.title: CVE-2017-6214 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
The tcp_splice_read function in net/ipv4/tcp.c in the Linux kernel before4.9.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loopand soft lockup) via vectors involving a TCP packet with the URG flag.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
